00024 #ifndef AMACRO_H
00025 #define AMACRO_H
00026 
00027 #ifdef __cplusplus
00028 extern "C" {
00029 #endif
00030 
00031 #include "gerb_file.h"
00032 
00033 
00034 enum opcodes {NOP,      /* No Operation */
00035              PUSH,     /* Ordinary stack operations. Uses float */
00036              PPUSH,    /* Parameter onto stack, 1 is first parameter and 
00037                          so on (compare gerber $1, $2 and so on */ 
00038              ADD, SUB, /* Mathematical operations */
00039              MUL, DIV, 
00040              PRIM};    /* Defines what primitive to draw. Inparameters
00041                         should be on the stack. */
00042 
00043 
00044 typedef struct instruction {
00045     enum opcodes opcode;
00046     union {
00047        int ival;
00048        float fval;
00049     } data;
00050     struct instruction *next;
00051 } instruction_t;
00052 
00053 typedef struct amacro {
00054     char *name;
00055     instruction_t *program;
00056     unsigned int nuf_push;  /* Nuf pushes in program to estimate stack size */
00057     struct amacro *next;
00058 } amacro_t;
00059 
00060 
00061 /*
00062  * Parses the definition of an aperture macro
00063  */
00064 amacro_t *parse_aperture_macro(gerb_file_t *fd);
00065 
00066 /*
00067  * Frees amacro struct completly
00068  */
00069 void free_amacro(amacro_t *amacro);
00070 
00071 /*
00072  * Print out parsed aperture macro. For debugging purpose.
00073  */
00074 void print_program(amacro_t *amacro);
00075 
00076 
00077 #ifdef __cplusplus
00078 }
00079 #endif
00080 
00081 #endif /* AMACRO_H */
